activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D Johnson

records.addlTxt:
9:12 AM Defendant Steven D Johnson in court.  Attorney Robert William Keller in court for Steven D Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense indicates they need more time to go over discovery and is seeking an adjourned status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's NOI to Intro Expert Testimony
DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven D Johnson in court.  Attorney Robert William Keller in court for Steven D Johnson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
